summary: Build a professional, ultra-modern marketing website for the NOX_WATCH watch store, using a clean white/blue theme, with easy navigation and core pages: Home (featured watches/collections), Product Catalog (images/prices/descriptions), About Us, and Contact (contact form + store details).
architectural_notes: Use a clean, ultra-modern aesthetic with a white + blue palette.
Provide a modular, easily editable structure so the owner can customize content without code-heavy changes.
Include reusable components for product cards and collections/featured sections.

existing_features.title: Create a site-wide layout for NOX_WATCH with a responsive top navigation (Home, Catalog, About, Contact), a consistent header/footer, and a clean white + blue visual system (typography, spacing, buttons, cards) suitable for a premium watch brand.

Implement a Home page that showcases featured watches and highlights top/premium collections with a modern hero section, featured grid, and collection highlights; keep all content easy to customize via a single front-end config/data file (e.g., arrays for featured products and collections).

Implement a Product Catalog page that displays a grid/list of watch product cards including image, price, and description, with basic UX for browsing (responsive grid and optional simple client-side filtering/sorting that is easy to remove/customize).

Implement an About Us page describing the NOX_WATCH store/brand, including the owner name (NAEEM) and a premium-brand narrative; keep copy easy to customize (centralized data or clearly editable text sections).

Implement a Contact page containing (1) store details and (2) a contact form with client-side validation. Store details must include: Owner Name: NAEEM, Mobile: +8801405917740, Location: Brahmanbaria Sodor, Somobei Market, 3rd Floor, Store Name: NOX_WATCH.

Add a clear, documented customization structure in the frontend so the user can easily swap images, update text, and change products/collections without touching multiple files (e.g., a single data module + reusable components for sections/cards).

Add required generated static images to the project under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Home and Catalog pages as default placeholders that the user can later replace with real product photography.
